meanings.definition: Force of character, determination, or nerve.
meanings.sent1: She showed great moxie when she stood up to the bully.
meanings.sent2: His moxie helped him overcome his fear of public speaking.
meanings.sent3: The little dog's moxie surprised everyone when it chased away the big cat.
meanings.sent4: Her moxie was like a shield, protecting her from self-doubt.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's moxie in the face of danger inspired the whole team.

meanings.sent1: The team's moxie on the field led them to victory.
meanings.sent2: She danced with moxie, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent3: The kitten's moxie in chasing its tail was adorable.
meanings.sent4: His moxie was a bright flame in the darkness of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The child's moxie in trying new things was truly admirable.

meanings.sent1: Her moxie in solving puzzles impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: He approached the task with moxie, completing it with ease.
meanings.sent3: The chef's moxie in creating new dishes was unmatched.
meanings.sent4: His moxie in fixing cars made him the go-to mechanic in town.
meanings.sent5: The artist's moxie in blending colors created stunning masterpieces.
